alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Garza; Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 15 at 3:26AM CDT until September 15 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Kent County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Dickens County in northwestern Texas... Garza County in northwestern Texas... Southern Crosby County in northwestern Texas... * Until 430 AM CDT. * At 325 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Caprock, or 14 miles east of Slaton, moving east at 35 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR THE CITY OF CAPROCK AND THEN KALGARY. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Locations impacted include... Post, Spur, White River Lake, Lake Alan Henry, Kalgary, and Caprock. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
